intro: Neurocalyx elatus, commonly known as the slender neurocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, slender stems and small, pale green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth, waxy surface, and it prefers moist, well-drained soils. Neurocalyx elatus is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests.
